instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message: No liquid-damage. Board chimes but has no video. No response when I plug in a USB keyboard. No lights. 1.85V on CPU vcore and .850V on GFX vcore. 3.4V on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>. To make sure I wasn't missing something I tried it with a known-good test screen. No video. 0V on L8300. I've never had to fight this battle with board before. Is there something that gives out with these boards?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message: Are you sure you are using a 2015 LCD assembly? L8300 should get a voltage pulse at least, so check it while turning it on.
